data.name: Electronics
data.description: Cell phones (except for the Samsung Galaxy Note 7), tablets, laptops, digital cameras, dry batteries are allowed in carry-on and checked baggage. Electronic cigarettes and vaping devices are only allowed in carry-on bags. See  https://www.tsa.gov/travel/security-screening/whatcanibring for more info.

data.name: Gifts
data.description: Packaged and fresh food are allowed as carry-on items, as well as in a checked-in bag. Alcoholic beverages are allowed if they are no more than 70% alcohol, and for carry-on bags, less than 3.4oz/100mL in volume. Replica weapons are subject to special instructions. See https://www.tsa.gov/travel/security-screening/whatcanibring for more info.

data.name: Toiletries
data.description: Liquids, gels and aerosols packed in a carry-on must follow the 3-1-1 liquids rule: 3.4 ounces or less per container, 1 quart size, clear, plastic, zip top bag (all liquids must fit in bag), and 1 bag per passenger. See https://www.tsa.gov/travel/security-screening/whatcanibring for more info.

data.name: Miscellaneous
data.description: Firearms can be in a checked bag, but are subject to special instructions. Most sharp items are prohibited from being in a carry-on bag. See https://www.tsa.gov/travel/security-screening/whatcanibring for more info.
